did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Bulletins on insect control from the Dept. of Military Sanitation, Medical Field Service School, Carlisle Barracks, Pa.; folder of notes on houseplants and flower preservation; and "Short History of Camp Driftwood, 1921," an account of a camping trip near Taughannock Falls, Tompkins County, N.Y. taken by Ries and his friends.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Donald T. Ries, Cornell University Class of 1925, Ph.D. 1930, was a professor of biology at Illinois State University, Normal, Illinois. He also served in the United States Army as a Sanitary Corps medical inspector during World War II.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Bulletins on insect control from the Dept. of Military Sanitation, Medical Field Service School, Carlisle Barracks, Pa.; folder of notes on houseplants and flower preservation; and "Short History of Camp Driftwood, 1921," an account of a camping trip near Taughannock Falls, Tompkins County, N.Y. taken by Ries and his friends.

controlaccess.head: Names:
controlaccess.corpname: United States. Army. Dept. of Military Sanitation.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Donald T. Ries miscellany, #1350. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

relatedmaterial.head: RELATED MATERIALS
relatedmaterial.p: Resumé and photograph available in Box 194 of Cornell University Alumni Office Deceased Alumni Files, #41-2-877.
